citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One sugar glider named “Hermione” was undergoing treatment directed by the veterinarian in March and April 2023. This
involved administering three medications twice daily. On the treatment sheet, there is no documentation for any of the
three PM doses that were supposed to be given on April 5, 2023. When asked, the facility stated that those doses were
likely missed.
Not following the attending veterinarian’s instructions for medications can lead to inadequate treatment of issues and
worsened outcomes for the animals. Failure to follow facility documentation standards can also lead to mistakes in
treatment. The facility must give medications as directed by the attending veterinarian. The facility must use appropriate
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
To be corrected by May 11, 2023.

In an enclosure housing two rabbits, there is a section of the wall that is broken near the door. The broken fragment of
concrete is displaced, exposing the mesh and other materials underneath.
Enclosures that are not kept in good repair can cause injury to the animals and expose them to materials that could be a
health hazard if ingested. Primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the
rabbits from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators out.
To be corrected by May 19, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
